text: ykuD was transcribed by SigK RNA polymerase from T4 of sporulation.

text: Localization of SpoIIE was shown to be dependent on the essential cell division protein FtsZ.
text_with_entity_marker: Localization of [E1]SpoIIE[/E1] was shown to be dependent on the essential cell division protein [E2]FtsZ[/E2].

text: In the shaA mutant, sigma(H)-dependent expression of spo0A and spoVG at an early stage of sporulation was sensitive to external NaCl.
text_with_entity_marker: In the shaA mutant, [E1]sigma(H)[/E1]-dependent expression of spo0A and [E2]spoVG[/E2] at an early stage of sporulation was sensitive to external NaCl.

text: sigmaF is controlled by a regulatory cascade involving an anti-sigma factor, SpoIIAB, an anti-anti-sigma factor, SpoIIAA, and a membrane-bound phosphatase, SpoIIE, which converts the inactive, phosphorylated form of SpoIIAA back to the active form.
text_with_entity_marker: sigmaF is controlled by a regulatory cascade involving an anti-sigma factor, [E1]SpoIIAB[/E1], an anti-anti-sigma factor, SpoIIAA, and a membrane-bound phosphatase, SpoIIE, which converts the inactive, phosphorylated form of [E2]SpoIIAA[/E2] back to the active form.

text: These results suggest that YfhP may act as a negative regulator for the transcription of yfhQ, yfhR, sspE and yfhP.

text: The ald promoter, like the sigE promoter, is believed to be recognized by sigmaA RNA polymerase, suggesting that sigmaK may inhibit sigmaA activity late in sporulation.
text_with_entity_marker: The ald promoter, like the [E1]sigE[/E1] promoter, is believed to be recognized by [E2]sigmaA[/E2] RNA polymerase, suggesting that sigmaK may inhibit sigmaA activity late in sporulation.

text: The first stage, which involves the phosphatase function of SpoIIE, depends on the cell division protein FtsZ and could correspond to the FtsZ-dependent assembly of SpoIIE into E-rings.
text_with_entity_marker: The first stage, which involves the phosphatase function of [E1]SpoIIE[/E1], depends on the cell division protein [E2]FtsZ[/E2] and could correspond to the FtsZ-dependent assembly of SpoIIE into E-rings.

text: The SpoIIE phosphatase indirectly activates sigmaF by dephosphorylating a protein (SpoIIAA-P) in the pathway that controls the activity of the transcription factor.
text_with_entity_marker: The [E1]SpoIIE[/E1] phosphatase indirectly activates [E2]sigmaF[/E2] by dephosphorylating a protein (SpoIIAA-P) in the pathway that controls the activity of the transcription factor.

text: Three new sigmaB-dependent genes (ydaE, ydaG and yfkM) encoding proteins with still unknown functions were also described.
text_with_entity_marker: Three new [E1]sigmaB[/E1]-dependent genes (ydaE, [E2]ydaG[/E2] and yfkM) encoding proteins with still unknown functions were also described.

text: Cell specificity is first established in the forespore under the control of the sigma F factor, which is itself activated through the action of the SpoIIE serine phosphatase, an enzyme targeted to the septum between the two cells.
text_with_entity_marker: Cell specificity is first established in the forespore under the control of the [E1]sigma F[/E1] factor, which is itself activated through the action of the [E2]SpoIIE[/E2] serine phosphatase, an enzyme targeted to the septum between the two cells.

text: A low level of GerE activated transcription of cotD by sigmaK RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of GerE repressed cotD transcription.
text_with_entity_marker: A low level of GerE activated transcription of cotD by [E1]sigmaK[/E1] RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of [E2]GerE[/E2] repressed cotD transcription.

text: sspG transcription also requires the DNA binding protein GerE.
text_with_entity_marker: [E1]sspG[/E1] transcription also requires the DNA binding protein [E2]GerE[/E2].

text: Furthermore, YtxH and YvyD seemed to be induced after phosphate starvation in the wild type in a sigma(B)-dependent manner and in the sigB mutant probably via sigma(H).
text_with_entity_marker: Furthermore, [E1]YtxH[/E1] and YvyD seemed to be induced after phosphate starvation in the wild type in a [E2]sigma(B)[/E2]-dependent manner and in the sigB mutant probably via sigma(H).

text: Transcription of the cotB, cotC, and cotX genes by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called GerE.
text_with_entity_marker: Transcription of the [E1]cotB[/E1], [E2]cotC[/E2], and cotX genes by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called GerE.

text: A low concentration of GerE activated cotB transcription by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase, whereas a higher concentration was needed to activate transcription of cotX or cotC.
text_with_entity_marker: A low concentration of GerE activated [E1]cotB[/E1] transcription by final [E2]sigma(K)[/E2] RNA polymerase, whereas a higher concentration was needed to activate transcription of cotX or cotC.

text: A low concentration of GerE activated cotB transcription by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase, whereas a higher concentration was needed to activate transcription of cotX or cotC.
text_with_entity_marker: A low concentration of GerE activated cotB transcription by final [E1]sigma(K)[/E1] RNA polymerase, whereas a higher concentration was needed to activate transcription of cotX or [E2]cotC[/E2].

text: We overproduced and purified sigma(X) from Escherichia coli and demonstrate that in vitro, both sigma(A) and sigma(X) holoenzymes recognize promoter elements within the sigX-ypuN control region.
text_with_entity_marker: We overproduced and purified sigma(X) from Escherichia coli and demonstrate that in vitro, both [E1]sigma(A)[/E1] and sigma(X) holoenzymes recognize promoter elements within the [E2]sigX[/E2]-ypuN control region.

text: GerE binds to a site on one of these promoters, cotX, that overlaps its -35 region.
text_with_entity_marker: [E1]GerE[/E1] binds to a site on one of these promoters, [E2]cotX[/E2], that overlaps its -35 region.

text: The Bacillus subtilis clpC operon is regulated by two stress induction pathways relying on either sigmaB or a class III stress induction mechanism acting at a sigmaA-like promoter.
text_with_entity_marker: The Bacillus subtilis [E1]clpC[/E1] operon is regulated by two stress induction pathways relying on either [E2]sigmaB[/E2] or a class III stress induction mechanism acting at a sigmaA-like promoter.

text: Our data demonstrate that the CtsR protein acts as a global repressor of the clpC operon, as well as other class III heat shock genes, by preventing unstressed transcription from either the sigmaB- or sigmaA-dependent promoter and might be inactivated or dissociate under inducing stress conditions.
text_with_entity_marker: Our data demonstrate that the [E1]CtsR[/E1] protein acts as a global repressor of the [E2]clpC[/E2] operon, as well as other class III heat shock genes, by preventing unstressed transcription from either the sigmaB- or sigmaA-dependent promoter and might be inactivated or dissociate under inducing stress conditions.

text: The class includes AsiA form bacteriophage T4, which inhibits Escherichia coli sigma 70; FlgM, present in both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, which inhibits the flagella sigma factor sigma 28; SpoIIAB, which inhibits the sporulation-specific sigma factor, sigma F and sigma G, of Bacillus subtilis; RbsW of B. subtilis, which inhibits stress response sigma factor sigma B; and DnaK, a general regulator of the heat shock response, which in bacteria inhibits the heat shock sigma factor sigma 32.

text: The sspH and sspL genes are recognized primarily by the forespore-specific sigma factor for RNA polymerase, sigmaG; the sspN-tlp operon is recognized equally well by sigmaG and the other forespore-specific sigma factor, sigmaF.

text: The sigma W regulon includes a penicillin binding protein (PBP4*) and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase (RacX), homologues of signal peptide peptidase (YteI), flotillin (YuaG), ABC transporters (YknXYZ), non-haem bromoperoxidase (YdjP), epoxide hydrolase (YfhM) and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
